column2: ResourceRelationship
column4: A relationship of one rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource) to another.

column2: resourceRelationshipID
column4: An identifier for an instance of relationship between one resource (the subject) and another (relatedResource, the object).

column2: resourceID
column4: An identifier for the resource that is the subject of the relationship.

column2: relatedResourceID
column4: An identifier for a related resource (the object, rather than the subject of the relationship).

column2: relationshipOfResource
column4: The relationship of the resource identified by relatedResourceID to the subject (optionally identified by the resourceID). Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

column2: relationshipAccordingTo
column4: The source (person, organization, publication, reference) establishing the relationship between the two resources.

column2: relationshipEstablishedDate
column4: The date-time on which the relationship between the two resources was established. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

column2: relationshipRemarks
column4: Comments or notes about the relationship between the two resources.

column2: A relationship of one rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource) to another.
An identifier for an instance of relationship between one resource (the subject) and another (relatedResource, the object).
An identifier for the resource that is the subject of the relationship.
An identifier for a related resource (the object, rather than the subject of the relationship).
The relationship of the resource identified by relatedResourceID to the subject (optionally identified by the resourceID). Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
The source (person, organization, publication, reference) establishing the relationship between the two resources.
The date-time on which the relationship between the two resources was established. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).
Comments or notes about the relationship between the two resources.

Resources can be thought of as identifiable records or instances of classes and may include, but need not be limited to Occurrences, Organisms, MaterialSamples, Events, Locations, GeologicalContexts, Identifications, or Taxa.
An instance of an Organism is the mother of another instance of an Organism.
duplicate of,  "mother of",  "endoparasite of",  "host to",  "sibling of",  "valid synonym of",  "located within".
Julie Woodruff.

1963-03-08T14:07-0600 is 8 Mar 1963 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC,  "2009-02-20T08:40Z" is 20 Feb 2009 8:40am UTC,  "1809-02-12" is 12 Feb 1809,  "1906-06" is Jun 1906,  "1971" is just that year,  "2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z" is the interval between 1 Mar 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC,  "2007-11-13/15" is the interval between 13 Nov 2007 and 15 Nov 2007.
mother and offspring collected from the same nest,  "pollinator captured in the act".
